p: Figure 3 reports the subtyping results for HBV-D (29 sequences from 1978 to 79 and 16 from 1994 to 95). HBV-D3 was the most prevalent in both groups (25/29, 86.2% in 1978–79, 13/16, 81.2% in 1994–95); HBV-D1 and HBV-D2 were observed in the remaining cases (HBV-D1: 1 case in 1978/79, 1 case in 1994/95; HBV-D2: 3 cases in 1978/79 and 2 cases in 1994/95).
